newsitem.title: USA: Bankers Trust fund cuts Argentina weight to zero.
newsitem.headline: Bankers Trust fund cuts Argentina weight to zero.

text.p: Bankers Trust Global Investment Management's BT Latin America mutual fund has slashed its Argentina weighting to almost zero from 5.6 percent, portfolio manager Emily Alejos said.
Aloejos was concerned the country was choosing a strategy of "pretty austere fiscal measures. We thought the outlook for economic growth was not favorable for equities."
"We can find more attractive growth stories in other countries," she said. Alejos said the $17 million fund boosted the weightings in Mexico and Chile.

At the end of August, Argentina went to a near-zero weighting from 5.6 percent in July; Mexico to 36 percent from 28 percent; Chile to 10 percent from 7.6 percent; Peru to 6 percent from 5.5 percent; Colombia to 4 percent from 2.9 percent; Venezuela unchanged at 6 percent; and Brazil 31 percent from 28 percent.
The cash position was slashed to 7 percent from 15 percent.
Aside from the fund, Bankers Trust manages a total of about $1 billion in assets in Latin America.
Bankers Trust Global Investment is a unit of Bankers Trust New York Corp. -- Jeff Benkoe, 212-859-1735.
